basics.name: Queena Wang
basics.label: Actuarial Associate
basics.summary: Actuarial Associate at PwC and part-time MFin student at LSE, with a BSc (Hons) in Mathematics and Statistics from the University of Edinburgh. Passionate about working at the intersection of finance, technology and data.

work.name: PwC
work.summary: Led on actuarial consulting and auditing projects (reinsurance, risk transfer, pension analytics) for corporate clients. Performed comprehensive analysis of financial statements for Industrials sector institutional clients. Collaborated with cross-functional teams to enhance analytical toolkits and support analytics-enabled advisory.
highlights: Analysed pension and insurance liabilities across 12 corporate clients; built cashflow models forecasting funding gaps with <5% variance
Supported pension buy-in/buy-out and restructuring projects by preparing tailored reports and presentations
Built >5 discounted cashflow models forecasting free cashflow and tax exposure under different capital structures
Led 9 client interviews to formulate practical solutions, projected to reduce cross-jurisdictional corporate tax leakage by 7-10%
Co-developed an AI-driven agent in Python that improved data processing efficiency by 50%
Selected member of PwC's New Joiner Committee; acted as panelist at 3 firm-wide panels and careers events

work.name: PwC
work.summary: Analysed factors affecting mortality rates by stress-testing longevity, demographic and financial assumptions. Modelled cashflows in ActKit to support the redesign of a defined-benefit pension scheme. Contributed to consulting engagement for a leading luxury retail client.
highlights: Reviewed >1500 data entries to identify systematic risk patterns and underlying cost drivers
Analysed market trends across 7 countries, competitors and growth drivers
Conducted peer benchmarking on >10 financial and operational KPIs
Helped build a fact-based, scalable international expansion plan for 3 new markets

work.name: HSBC
work.summary: Completed a structured insight program covering investment banking, capital markets, trading desks, financial modelling, deal structuring, and trading simulations. Shadowed product and coverage teams on live case studies.
highlights: Shadowed product and coverage teams on 3 live case studies across Consumer and Industrial sectors
Collaborated with peers to produce a 20-page pitchbook for a retail client
Analysed market trends and competitor benchmarks via CapitalIQ, recommending equity financing

volunteer.summary: Founded the society and grew membership to over 100 within one year. Secured sponsorships and partnerships with IFoA, Aon, and Scotland Actuary Society.
highlights: Grew membership to over 100 within one year
Secured sponsorships and partnerships with IFoA, Aon, and Scotland Actuary Society, raising over £2000
Organized and delivered over 10 events, including panel discussions, case competitions, and technical workshops

education.institution: London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)

courses: Several Variable Calculus and Differential Equations

awards.title: Adventure X Hackathon - Winner (1st Place)
awards.summary: Developed a voice-driven AI journaling agent for visually impaired users and emotional wellbeing tracking; achieved 173 out of 205 audience votes, placing 1st. Led database design and API integration, connecting speech-to-text pipelines with journaling and analytics modules.

awards.title: Mathematical Contest in Modelling (MCM) Honours Award
Kaggle Time Market Data Forecasting Silver Award

interests.name: Cooking
keywords: Fusion of Sichuan and Mediterranean styles

projects.summary: Optimisation project using Operational Research methods & Python
highlights: OR methods
Python

R
